projectDesc.p: "留春令" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the Tune “Making the Spring Stay”
On the painted screen, the edge of sky,
awaken from dream, I can still vaguely see,
the misty water of the Ten Isles of Immortals.
Pinching the red paper of the letter I am about to send,
which writes about my endless spring sorrows.
I once leant vainly on the banister of the high tower on the bank where we parted,
facing a thousand miles of Jiangnan.
In the sound of the splitting current downstairs,
is the tears I shed that day when I ascended the high tower.
